title: Spent 9 days under army security: Deposed Nepal PM Oli moves to private house
description: Following widespread unrest in Nepal, former Prime Minister KP Sharma Oli, after nine days under army protection, has moved to a private residence in Bhaktapur. His previous house was burned during Gen Z-led protests. While other political figures sought army shelter, only Sher Bahadur Deuba and his spouse remain under military protection due to injuries sustained during the demonstrations.

description: President Trump suggested potential government action against networks with negative coverage, even hinting at license revocation. This followed ABC's suspension of Jimmy Kimmel after controversial remarks about Charlie Kirk, sparking protests and criticism. The controversy ignited after Kimmel's comments on his show, leading to regulatory scrutiny and accusations of censorship, further intensifying the ongoing feud between Trump and late-night hosts.

title: 'Took my passport, green card and vanished': US cop abandons wife in Hyderabad
description: Hana Ahmed Khan, an Hyderabad woman, faces a nightmare after her US-based police officer husband, Mohammad Zain Uddin, allegedly abandoned her in Hyderabad, taking her passport and green card. She married Zain in 2022 and joined him in the US in 2024, but he left her during a trip to Hyderabad in 2025.

description: US President Donald Trump's helicopter, Marine One, made an unscheduled landing near Luton due to a hydraulic issue during his departure from the UK after a state visit. The incident, described as a “minor hydraulic issue,” prompted the pilots to land as a precaution. Trump and the First Lady safely transferred to a support helicopter.

title: Delhi hit-and-run: Rammed by speeding car, scooter rider falls off flyover, dies
description: Rakesh Kumar Agarwal, a 49-year-old scooter rider, tragically died after being struck by a speeding car on the NH-24 Manglam Cut Flyover in Delhi. The impact caused him to fall off the flyover. The car driver fled the scene, and police are investigating the incident, having identified the car's owner. Agarwal leaves behind his wife and two daughters.

title: The silent gallbladder red flag most people mistake for shoulder strain
description: Gallstones, hardened deposits in the gallbladder, can surprisingly cause referred pain in the shoulder due to shared nerve pathways. Inflammation from gallstones irritates the phrenic nerve, leading to shoulder discomfort alongside abdominal pain, nausea, and indigestion. Treatment typically involves surgical removal of the gallbladder, though dietary changes may offer temporary relief.

title: 7.8-magnitude earthquake hits Russia's Kamchatka - shocking visuals emerge
description: A powerful 7.8-magnitude earthquake struck Russia's Kamchatka region, triggering a tsunami alert that was later lifted. Visuals showed buildings swaying and objects shaking, but initial reports indicated no significant damage. Located on the Ring of Fire, Kamchatka is prone to seismic activity, having experienced a mega-quake and tsunami just months prior.

title: Powerful magnitude 7.8 earthquake shakes Russia’s far east Kamchatka region
description: The quake’s epicentre was 127 kilometres (79 miles) east of Petropavlovsk-Kamchatsky and it struck at 6:58 a.m. on Friday local time

Did Simone Biles really write a blog mocking Charlie Kirk after his death?
description: A false story spread after Charlie Kirk's death. It claimed Simone Biles wrote a blog about him. The post referenced Kirk's past insults towards Biles. It alleged Biles responded after his death. Fact-checks confirmed the blog was fake. Biles made no statement. Other false posts also circulated after Kirk's death. These posts included fake athlete donations and calls for silence.

The region is grappling with the aftermath of devastating floods, causing significant infrastructure damage and loss of life.

The actor breathed his last at GEM Hospital in Chennai on Thursday night. description: Rahul Gandhi has accused the Chief Election Commissioner of shielding “vote chors” and obstructing investigations into voter deletions, presenting alleged proof of manipulation in Karnataka's Aland constituency. The BJP has dismissed these claims as lies, while the Election Commission has refuted them, stating that deletions cannot be done online.

title: 48-hour deadline: Elon Musk to xAI staff; ‘Send me what you did, past four weeks too’
description: Elon Musk has requested xAI employees to submit detailed one-page summaries of their past accomplishments and future plans, setting a tight deadline amidst company turbulence. This demand follows Musk's pattern of employee performance reviews across his ventures.

title: GitHub rules: CEO Thomas Dohmke to employees; No saying ‘I don’t want to use GitHub’
description: GitHub CEO Thomas Dohmke mandates AI tool usage, like GitHub Copilot, for all employees, regardless of their roles. This expectation aligns with Microsoft's approach of incorporating AI usage into employee performance evaluations. Dohmke emphasizes that this isn't about tracking code lines but fostering a culture of continuous learning and adaptation across all departments.

title: China’s AI chip ban: Nvidia CEO Jensen Huang; ‘I’m disappointed with what I see’
description: Nvidia CEO Jensen Huang expressed disappointment over China's directive to its tech giants, including ByteDance and Alibaba, to halt purchases of Nvidia's AI chips like the RTX Pro 6000D. This decision follows assessments by Chinese regulators indicating that domestic AI processors now rival Nvidia's offerings. Huang acknowledged the volatile nature of Nvidia's China business due to ongoing US-China discussions.

title: Lauren Kyle hosted charity Poker night backing kids for Oilers Youth Foundation
description: Lauren Kyle, Connor McDavid's wife, hosted a charity poker tournament benefiting the Oilers Foundation's 'Every Kid Deserves a Shot' initiative, raising funds and awareness for youth sports in Alberta. While the event highlighted the team's community impact, Connor McDavid's contract situation remains uncertain as he enters the final year of his current deal, focusing on the upcoming season.

title: Destiny blames Musk after getting banned from Twitch — 'my income is gone'
description: Political streamer Destiny, Steven Bonnell II, faces a Twitch ban he attributes to a coordinated effort by Elon Musk and conservatives, alleging it's free speech issues following controversial comments on Charlie Kirk. Destiny claims his income is eliminated due to the ban, triggered by 'Hateful Conduct' accusations related to discrimination.
